page.title: 13LOCAL HISTORY.
page.content: The first people who lived in Bilsdale were thought to have crossed from France during the Ice Age when the English Channel was frozen over.As there are no Roman remains it is difficult to tell whether they ever came to Bilsdale .We have a good many remains to tell us that the Normans came here such as field names,peoples names and Helmsley Castle.Iron,glass,pottery have been made here and there have been remains of furnaces etc found. These activities are not carried out now neither is coppice, wodding, jet mining, blacksmithing which were done before.There are less people live here because farming has become more mechanical and therefore less people are required to carry out the work.After the Ice Age the first trees were pines.
